results.title: In other lands: Bohemia
results.creator_credit: Clyde E. Elliott and Post Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: The formation of the Czechoslovak Republic at the close of the World War brought together as the Czech, or Bohemian, nation the Slavs of Bohemia, Moravia and Slovakia. Czechoslovakia owes its sound financial and industrial position to men who ome of that enduring Slavic stock which for centuries has dominated Bohemia and Moravia. Shows Bohemians in traditional peasant dress and tells of the Bohemian farming peasants way of life - selling their produce at the market, attending church, celebrating a wedding, and particularly focuses on their various costume of dress. Photography by Horace C. Shimeld.

results.title: In open air: a portrait of the American impressionists
results.creator_credit: Roger Snodgrass, Paul Johnson and Smithsonian Institute
results.brief_description: A documentary about the late 19th century American Impressionists. The film reveals the nature of these artists’ sensibility and work; the specific French Impressionists from whom they drew inspiration; and the various artistic communities which they founded in America.

results.title: In a rehearsal room
results.creator_credit: David W. Hahn and Otter Productions
results.brief_description: In Paris, at the turn of the century, two young dancers meet in a rehearsal room. Warming up, each is very aware of the other. Tentatively they come together and then, caught up in the music, they dance. A blend of ballet, music and romance.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.creator_credit: Henri Lacam, Jacques Armand Cardon and International Film Promotions
results.brief_description: Animated philosophical tale about the moulding of children into a social pattern. Futuristic piece which suggests that society will consist of two classes - the rulers and the ruled. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.brief_description: A social and philosophical fable about a little boy who has a plank fastened to his back. The day it is taken off is a day of great relief. The boy then discovers that his body bears the mark of a shoe sole and heel.

results.title: Imperial city
results.creator_credit: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films
results.brief_description: In 1911, the British built a new capital for India. The creation of New Delhi was the greatest artistic enterprise of the British Empire, and we follow the architects in a search for a style incorporating British and Indian architecture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films

results.title: I.A.A.F. track and field events, Helsinki
results.creator_credit: Guy Butler and International Amateur Athletic Federation
results.brief_description: Documentary highlights of the diverse sectors of the Helsinki 1952 Olympic Games ranging from the Opening Ceremony to specific events, ie field, high jump, long jump. Shows respective winners at these events and the lead up to their victory. Silent film with English subtext.

results.title: I Wouldn't Like to Be the Bait
results.brief_description: Take a wonderful journey through the rich and varied fishing areas of South Australia. A geographic presentation gives us not only a tapestry of the best fishing areas, but also a beautifully cinematic vision of the magnificent Southern Coastline. The Murray Valley, Coorong, Eyre and York Peninsulas, and the Spencer and Flinders Gulfs are explored, and sophisticated graphics give both an insight into the best season to fish and the species to be caught in those areas. A summary of the tourist facilities and other attractions is also presented, which makes this program the ideal guide to the coastal and freshwater recreational areas of South Australia.
